Package withplugin.plugins

Class ClientPlugin

java.lang.Object
fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPlugin
withplugin.plugins.ClientPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
fr.sorbonne_u.components.PluginI, Serializable
public class ClientPlugin extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPlugin
A plugin component that extends the functionality of a client component within a sensor network. This plugin facilitates the interaction between the client and various network services including sensor nodes, registration services, and clock synchronization servers. The ClientPlugin handles tasks such as setting up communication ports, connecting to necessary services, and managing request executions both synchronously and asynchronously. It also deals with the aggregation and processing of query results from sensor nodes.

Key functionalities include:

  • Initial setup of outbound and inbound ports for communication with other network components.
  • Connection management to ensure the client can interact with the clock server and registration server.
  • Execution of sensor node requests, handling both synchronous and asynchronous operations.
  • Collection and merging of results from sensor nodes based on requests issued by the client.
  • Logging and error management to provide debugging support and robust error handling.
Author:
Malek Bouzarkouna, Younes Chetouani, Mohamed Amine Zemali

      public void uninstall() throws Exception

      Throws:

    • getRegisterReference

      public fr.sorbonne_u.utils.aclocks.ClocksServerOutboundPort getRegisterReference()
      Retrieves a reference to the Clock Server's outbound port. This port is used to communicate with the Clock Server for synchronizing time across various components.
      Returns:
      The outbound port connected to the Clock Server.

    • requestNodeAndConnectByName

      public void requestNodeAndConnectByName(String nodeName) throws Exception
      Attempts to find and connect to a node by its name. This method retrieves the connection information for the specified node and, if found, initiates a connection. If the node is not found, it logs an appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      nodeName - The name of the node to connect to.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error during the connection process.

    • scheduleTasks

      public void scheduleTasks(List<fr.sorbonne_u.cps.sensor_network.interfaces.RequestI> requests, Instant start, fr.sorbonne_u.utils.aclocks.AcceleratedClock ac, int delayBetweenTasks, boolean isAsynchronous)
      Schedules a list of requests to be executed sequentially with a defined delay between each execution. The tasks are scheduled based on a starting instant and are spaced out by a specified delay. This method leverages an AcceleratedClock to determine the precise nanoseconds delay until each task's intended start time, ensuring accurate scheduling according to the clock's acceleration.
      Parameters:
      requests - The list of RequestI objects to be executed.
      start - The starting Instant from which the first task is scheduled.
      ac - The AcceleratedClock used to calculate precise delay times for task scheduling.
      delayBetweenTasks - The delay in seconds between consecutive task executions.

    • acceptRequestResult

      public void acceptRequestResult(String requestURI, fr.sorbonne_u.cps.sensor_network.interfaces.QueryResultI result)
      Accepts and stores a query result associated with a specific request URI. The method is thread-safe and updates the result map atomically, ensuring that multiple threads can safely operate on it. If no list exists for the given URI, a new list is created.
      Parameters:
      requestURI - The URI of the request to which the result belongs.
      result - The query result to store.

    • mergeAndPrint

      public void mergeAndPrint(String requestURI) throws Exception
      Merges all query results associated with a given request URI and prints the merged result. This method first retrieves the list of results for the URI and then combines them based on the type of query (gather or boolean). If the list is empty, it logs that no results were found. Otherwise, it merges the results and prints the final aggregated result.
      Parameters:
      requestURI - The URI of the request whose results are to be merged and printed.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during result processing or printing.
